news.title: Here's how much prices are rising across the fashion industry
news.summary: Fashion prices are on average $17 higher this year compared to last. Prices have been steadily creeping up over the last few years, hitting the fashion industry.

news.title: WBD rejected three Paramount takeover offers, the last for just under $24 per share, sources say
news.summary: WBD said this week it had received "unsolicited interest" from multiple parties. WBD: We have been approached by multiple parties about a possible acquisition.

news.title: Beyond Meat shares surge for a third day in a row as meme traders jump on board
news.summary: It's the latest in an extraordinary week for the stock, which on Tuesday enjoyed its best day ever. On Tuesday, the stock was up more than 6%, its best performance since September 2009.

news.title: Auto giant Volkswagen warns of output stoppages amid Nexperia chip disruption
news.summary: Volkswagen warns of temporary production outages citing China's export restrictions on semiconductors made by Nexperia. Volkswagen on Wednesday warned of temporaryProduction outages.

news.title: Gold and related stocks are falling for a second day. The metal is off 8% from high
news.summary: There is no macroeconomic or geopolitical event driving the pullback in gold prices this week, according to the Swiss bank UBS. UBS: There is no Macroeconomic or Geopolitical Event driving the Pullback in Gold Prices.

news.title: Berkshire’s stock presents Warren Buffett with a ‘golden cross’ as his retirement nears
news.summary: Shares of Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway have produced a bullish “golden cross” chart pattern. Less than three months before the famed investor is set to retire.

news.title: Here’s a theory on why gold suffered its biggest one-day fall in more than ten years, and it’s linked to the U.S. economy.
news.summary: Robin Brooks, senior fellow at the Brookings Institution, sought to explain the flows driving the price of gold. Brooks: "I think we're in the midst of a global gold rush"

news.title: The U.S. jobs market was wobbling before the shutdown. Now what?
news.summary: The U.S. labor market had started to sputter well before the government shutdown began in October. There’s little evidence to suggest finding a job has gotten any easier.

news.title: GE Vernova’s revenue beats by widest-ever margin, as electrification orders double
news.summary: GE Vernova’s stock rallies toward its first gain in seven sessions after quarterly orders and revenue blow past expectations. GE Vernova shares up 2.7% in pre-market trading.

news.title: Barclays takes a victory lap over lack of First Brands exposure. But it did get burned on Tricolor.
news.summary: Barclays CEO says the bank wasn't stuck with exposure to fallen auto-parts company First Brands because of its own due diligence. But it was lumbered with Tricolor exposure.
